message: Mostly posting links and thoughts  eg http://www.fims.uwo.ca/newmedia/newmedia2004/energy/energy_unrau_wolf_d2_p.htm

There is a technology that heats the water as it is piped, it takes a great deal of power to heat it to a good temp just well traveling the pipe, but overal it uses less then heating a tank constantly.  I do not know what it is called.  Also, it may help with freezing/bursting pipes.
